rdf:Alt.rdf:li: {\rtf1 }
{\rtf1 hi and welcome to Tec m51 95 today we're}
{\rtf1 going to be talking about editing for}
{\rtf1 cohesion sort of in the larger context}
{\rtf1 of editing for organization organizing}
{\rtf1 documents and a lot of this content will}
{\rtf1 come from revising professional writing}
{\rtf1 chapter 8 so what is cohesion cohesion}
{\rtf1 occurs in a text if the movement from}
{\rtf1 parts apart is easy to follow so that's}
{\rtf1 sort of the formal definition I would}
{\rtf1 really like to think about it in two}
{\rtf1 distinct ways first we've got sort of}
{\rtf1 the macro level cohesion right do}
{\rtf1 paragraphs of text connect with one}
{\rtf1 another and do sections that include}
{\rtf1 multiple paragraphs do those connect}
{\rtf1 with one another is there a flow from}
{\rtf1 the beginning to the end of the document}
{\rtf1 and we'll talk about that a little bit}
{\rtf1 in some of the other videos today we're}
{\rtf1 going to focus on micro level cohesion}
{\rtf1 really looking at cohesion within a}
{\rtf1 paragraph so connecting one sentence to}
{\rtf1 the next sentence and making sure that}
{\rtf1 because the sentences connect will have}
{\rtf1 a cohesive paragraphs okay so one of the}
{\rtf1 strategies for really identifying and}
{\rtf1 revising and editing content for}
{\rtf1 cohesion is what's called the given new}
{\rtf1 principle and the given new principle}
{\rtf1 really has is pretty easy to follow and}
{\rtf1 it's really got two main ideas and the}
{\rtf1 first is we've got some given}
{\rtf1 information that we're giving the}
{\rtf1 audience and that appears in the}
{\rtf1 subjects law and as we discussed in}
{\rtf1 previous videos and in previous content}
{\rtf1 in this course the subject slot is}
{\rtf1 typically the first noun phrase in a}
{\rtf1 sentence new information on the other}
{\rtf1 hand appears in the predicate slot and}
{\rtf1 as we discussed in previous videos and}
{\rtf1 content in the class the predicate spot}
{\rtf1 is typically started with the verb}
{\rtf1 phrase and all of the content after the}
{\rtf1 verb phrase okay so that's important to}
{\rtf1 know here is an example of a question of}
{\rtf1 a sentence the semester began}
{\rtf1 August our given information is our}
{\rtf1 subject the semester and our new}
{\rtf1 information is that it began in August}
{\rtf1 right so there's really two bits or}
{\rtf1 ideas in this sentence one is that}
{\rtf1 there's a semester and two is that it}
{\rtf1 began in August okay so how do we}
{\rtf1 implement this given new principle to}
{\rtf1 help us revise or edit for cohesion well}
{\rtf1 there's really two ways or two main}
{\rtf1 patterns that we can use to do this}
{\rtf1 there's the abbc pattern in the a B AC}
{\rtf1 pattern and these letters are maybe a}
{\rtf1 little confusing to you at first}
{\rtf1 but these are just ways to label}
{\rtf1 sentences so let's take a look at a}
{\rtf1 couple examples and I think that will}
{\rtf1 help clarify things so here's an example}
{\rtf1 of the abbc pattern and really what}
{\rtf1 we're seeing is each sentence has two}
{\rtf1 ideas one in the subject and one in the}
{\rtf1 predicate and we're going to label them}
{\rtf1 as such so the first sentence here is}
{\rtf1 the semester began at the end of August}
{\rtf1 the semester is labeled a that's our}
{\rtf1 first idea began at the end of August is}
{\rtf1 labeled B that's our second idea in our}
{\rtf1 second sentence we need to connect so}
{\rtf1 for us to have cohesion there needs to}
{\rtf1 be some connection between the first}
{\rtf1 sentence in the second sentence and in}
{\rtf1 this case we're connecting with the}
{\rtf1 predicate so we're saying we're}
{\rtf1 restating August and that's labeled B as}
{\rtf1 well is usually the busiest time of the}
{\rtf1 school year that's labeled C right so}
{\rtf1 the cohesion occurs because there's some}
{\rtf1 connection between the first and second}
{\rtf1 sentence we can look at an example of a}
{\rtf1 B AC and that's in the first two}
{\rtf1 sentences and I also just added an AC CD}
{\rtf1 to look at the second Sun tell the}
{\rtf1 second sentence connects to the third}
{\rtf1 sentence just to show you that this}
{\rtf1 doesn't just occur between two sentences}
{\rtf1 in isolation but it actually occurs it}
{\rtf1 can occur throughout an entire paragraph}
{\rtf1 so sentence one is the same exact}
{\rtf1 sentence is the previous example the}
{\rtf1 semester began at the end of August}
{\rtf1 instead of referring to the predicate or}
{\rtf1 the thing that's labeled B we refer back}
{\rtf1 to the thing that's labeled a the idea}
{\rtf1 that slate of a so we say the start of}
{\rtf1 the semester so that's labeled a again}
{\rtf1 is usually the busiest time of the}
{\rtf1 school year that's our new piece of}
{\rtf1 information in this sentence and that's}
{\rtf1 labeled C so to connect the second and}
{\rtf1 third sentence we've got this idea of}
{\rtf1 busyness or busiest time of the school}
{\rtf1 year and we repeat that idea in the}
{\rtf1 third sentence so that's labeled C the}
{\rtf1 busyness can often be overwhelming to}
{\rtf1 students and that's labeled D ok so}
{\rtf1 these are just some examples you can}
{\rtf1 kind of pause the slide if you need to}
{\rtf1 to see how we can use these patterns and}
{\rtf1 just give a new principal to create}
{\rtf1 cohesion from sentence to sentence in a}
{\rtf1 paragraph so violating the given new}
{\rtf1 principal here's an example the letters}
{\rtf1 don't really matter all that much but I}
{\rtf1 labeled them for you a b c a and c a d e}
{\rtf1 so these are these are examples of}
{\rtf1 sentences that are not adhering to the}
{\rtf1 given new principle and I'll just read}
{\rtf1 this to you or you can read this on your}
{\rtf1 own in your head but you can see how}
{\rtf1 it's difficult to understand when}
{\rtf1 there's no cohesion in a paragraph so}
{\rtf1 read the semester began at the end of}
{\rtf1 August the busiest time of the year is}
{\rtf1 the beginning of the semester}
{\rtf1 overwhelmed is what students feel during}
{\rtf1 this time right so all three sentences}
{\rtf1 are related but they don't necessarily}
{\rtf1 connect with one another so this is an}
{\rtf1 example of introducing new information}
{\rtf1 and not connecting it back to fold}
{\rtf1 information or information that's}
{\rtf1 presented in the previous sentence so}
{\rtf1 real quickly three strategies for}
{\rtf1 cohesion how can we achieve this}
{\rtf1 the first is repeating the noun phrase}
{\rtf1 so in this example we've got a sentence}
{\rtf1 the first sentence reads the hard drive}
{\rtf1 was built using new technology we just}
{\rtf1 repeat that word technology this}
{\rtf1 technology was developed in the last}
{\rtf1 year and that's}
{\rtf1 a BBC pattern I want to present to you}
{\rtf1 all three of these strategies though}
{\rtf1 because if we just repeated the noun}
{\rtf1 phrase over and over and over again the}
{\rtf1 sentence would actually be quite}
{\rtf1 repetitive and boring to the reader and}
{\rtf1 so we want to sort of vary the use of}
{\rtf1 these strategies as we're creating and}
{\rtf1 editing for cohesions}
{\rtf1 in our documents our second strategy is}
{\rtf1 to use a synonym so this hard drive was}
{\rtf1 built using new technology that's our}
{\rtf1 a/b we're going to go back to a and say}
{\rtf1 this hardware instead of hard drive}
{\rtf1 similar sounding word but it's a synonym}
{\rtf1 for hard drive it was included in the}
{\rtf1 new computer so we can use a synonym or}
{\rtf1 thirdly we can use a pronoun the hard}
{\rtf1 drive was built using new technology and}
{\rtf1 then it was developed by engineers at}
{\rtf1 Apple connecting it with new technology}
{\rtf1 or replacing new technology with the}
{\rtf1 pronoun it okay so those are three}
{\rtf1 strategies for cohesion before we close}
{\rtf1 up this video I want to quickly talk}
{\rtf1 about strategies for editing and}
{\rtf1 teaching cohesion so if you find}
{\rtf1 yourself teaching students or giving}
{\rtf1 feedback to students about their writing}
{\rtf1 and how to create cohesion their writing}
{\rtf1 really the thing that I want to hammer}
{\rtf1 home is this idea of big picture first}
{\rtf1 right so it doesn't make sense to take a}
{\rtf1 five page document and just start}
{\rtf1 labeling things a B BC BC C D but that}
{\rtf1 would be crazy for you to do as an}
{\rtf1 editor and that would be crazy for you}
{\rtf1 to teach your students to do as writers}
{\rtf1 and so starting at the high level of}
{\rtf1 when you're editing for organization}
{\rtf1 it's really important that you just read}
{\rtf1 the document as a whole does and then}
{\rtf1 ask yourself a couple questions one does}
{\rtf1 this paragraph make sense right if it}
{\rtf1 does if it makes sense you may want to}
{\rtf1 look at sentences and how they connect}
{\rtf1 with one another but it may not make}
{\rtf1 sense to start to label things and use}
{\rtf1 this given new principle yet another}
{\rtf1 question you can ask yourself does it}
{\rtf1 have one controlling idea is there one}
{\rtf1 main idea in this paragraph}
{\rtf1 what is that main idea and then thirdly}
{\rtf1 does it connect to the document as a}
{\rtf1 whole does this paragraph connect to the}
{\rtf1 paragraph before it in the paragraph}
{\rtf1 after it and if there's if the answer to}
{\rtf1 any of those three questions are no then}
{\rtf1 you may have an issue with cohesion}
{\rtf1 right and so that's when we can so it's}
{\rtf1 really starting at the big picture and}
{\rtf1 then coming in to the more specific}
{\rtf1 strategies and so as you're as you're}
{\rtf1 editing documents as you're teaching}
{\rtf1 students to write longer documents it's}
{\rtf1 important to teach them to connect}
{\rtf1 sentences to one another but it's also}
{\rtf1 important to teach them to start with}
{\rtf1 the big picture and then kind of zero in}
{\rtf1 on the given new principle as a strategy}
{\rtf1 for creating cohesion okay so there's}
{\rtf1 some practice exercises that I'd like}
{\rtf1 you to complete once you complete those}
{\rtf1 we'll be done with this video}
